tool.name: Run differential expression analysis
tool.description: Run various differential expression analysis methods
tool.command:
run_dexpr.R -c $counts -o $output #if $method=="--deseqpar" or $method=="--deseqloc" or $method=="--deseq2par" or $method=="--deseq2loc" -p $output2 #end if $method
#for $N in $samples ${N.sampletype} #end for

param.name: sampletype
param.label: Define type of each column in file (except first column, that contain gene name)
param.option: do not use this column at all

param.name: method
param.label: Methods
param.option: DESeq local (mandatory for only one condition or lack of repeats)
DESeq2 local (mandatory for only one condition or lack of repeats)

param.name: filter
param.label: Filter out reads with less counts in one of conditions

data.name: output2
data.filter: method=="--deseqpar" or method=="--deseqloc" or method=="--deseq2par" or method=="--deseq2loc"

tool.help:
Run differential expression analysis with DESeq, DESeq2, edgeR, metagenomeSeq or simple Mann-Whitney-Wilcoxon test.
Requires raw count table (with header) in format: gene/exon name sample1 sample2 sample3 ....
Filter out genes with too little counts for one of conditions (optional).
Returns table with mean values for conditions, foldChange, log2foldChange, p-value for each selected method.
Author: Julia
